name: Prima facie evidence by third party documents
text: §490:1-202    A document in due form purporting to be a bill of lading, policy or certificate of insurance, official weigher's or inspector's certificate, consular invoice, or any other document authorized or required by the contract to be issued by a third party shall be prima facie evidence of its own authenticity and genuineness and of the facts stated in the document by the third party. [L 1965, c 208, §1-202; HRS §490:1-202]
